message.content:
cs.CR, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.IR 

This paper deals with the problem of detecting compromised accounts in large-scale online service providers, which falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). The paper proposes a machine learning-based approach to predict which accounts are likely to be compromised in the future and generate suspicious activity, which involves the use of classification models and feature engineering techniques (cs.LG). The paper also discusses the use of login data and other account activity traces to derive features, which can be used to detect suspicious activity (cs.SI). Additionally, the paper highlights the importance of early warning systems in detecting compromised accounts, which is relevant to the field of cyber security (cs.CY). Finally, the paper discusses the use of real-world production data to evaluate the proposed approach, which involves the use of data mining and statistical analysis techniques (cs.IR).
